title: Introduction to Trigonometry
content:
Module 4, Lesson 1: Introduction to Trigonometry

Introduction

This lesson covers Introduction to Trigonometry within the broader study of Trigonometry. Mastering these concepts will give you a solid foundation for subsequent lessons and real-world applications.

Key Concepts

1. Core Definitions

We begin with precise definitions that form the bedrock of Introduction to Trigonometry. A rigorous understanding of terminology prevents ambiguity and enables exact communication and proof.

2. Fundamental Theorems and Results

The central theorems of Introduction to Trigonometry provide powerful tools for solving problems. We state each result clearly, explain the intuition behind it, and work through representative examples.

3. Worked Examples

Each concept is illustrated with step-by-step worked examples. Pay close attention to the reasoning at each step — it is as important as the final answer.

4. Common Misconceptions

Students often confuse closely related ideas in Introduction to Trigonometry. We highlight these distinctions explicitly so you can avoid common errors in exams and practical work.

Summary

You have completed the study of Introduction to Trigonometry in Module 4 (Trigonometry). The key ideas covered in this lesson will be built upon in subsequent lessons. Attempt the quiz to consolidate your understanding before moving on.

quiz.question: In a right triangle, which side is the hypotenuse?
options: The side opposite the right angle
